reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every 90 days, with a midterm report by 31 March 2011 and a full report by 31 May 2011
summary:
10. All parties are urged to cooperate fully with UNOCI and French Forces operations.

11. UNOCI is requested to support the provision of security for the Government and key political stakeholders.

12. Ivorian stakeholders are urged to restore non-governmental media broadcasting and allow equitable access to media.

13. UNOCI is to continue monitoring the comprehensive ceasefire agreement.

14. UNOCI is authorized to use all necessary means to carry out its mandate.

15. The protection of civilians mandate is reiterated.

16. The Council reaffirms its readiness to impose targeted sanctions against those threatening the peace process.

17. The authorization for French Forces to support UNOCI is extended until 30 June 2011.

18. The Secretary-General is requested to provide a midterm report by 31 March 2011 and a full report by 31 May 2011.

19. A technical assessment mission will be deployed to Côte d’Ivoire after legislative elections.

20. The Council will remain seized of the matter.
